message.content:
Probabilistic Methods, Rule Learning. 

Probabilistic Methods: The paper discusses the need to merge knowledge bases that may have differing opinions, and the objective of integration is to construct one system that exploits all the knowledge that is available and has good performance. This involves probabilistic reasoning to combine the knowledge from different sources.

Rule Learning: The paper describes the methodology of knowledge integration, which involves constructing an integrated knowledge base from several separate sources. This involves learning rules from the separate knowledge bases and combining them to form a single system. The implemented system (INTEG.3) is also described, which uses rule-based reasoning to integrate knowledge.
